sentences.en: Ben Brantley's article on Sir Ian McKellen rekindled many memories.
sentences.cn: 本•布兰特利关于伊恩•麦凯伦爵士的文章唤回许多记忆。

sentences.en: Earth day 1990 helped to rekindle the excitement of the green movement.
sentences.cn: 1990年的地球日重新掀起了绿色运动的声势.

sentences.en: How do flat marriages rekindle their romance?
sentences.cn: 平淡的婚姻怎样重新点燃浪漫 呢 ?

sentences.en: Is there anything could rekindle his extinct passion?
sentences.cn: 有什么事情可重燃他逝去的热情 呢 ?

sentences.en: It wanted so little to rekindle her dying affection.
sentences.cn: 她非常容易重新燃起已经熄灭的感情.

sentences.en: Please tell me your guy's not trying to rekindle things with my sister again.
sentences.cn: 麻烦你告诉我,他不是又想和我姐姐旧情复燃吧?

sentences.en: She wants to rekindle the fire.
So us reject any among us who seeks to reopen wounds and to rekindle old hatreds.
sentences.cn: 所以,我们应该驳斥我们之中企图使旧创复发,旧恨重燃的人.

sentences.en: The trial has rekindled painful memories of the war.
sentences.cn: 这场审判又唤起了人们对战争的痛苦回忆。

sentences.en: There are fears that the series could rekindle animosity between the two countries.
sentences.cn: 有人担忧这一系列事件会再次引发两国之间的敌对。

sentences.en: They tried to rekindle the flames of romance.

trans.tran_en: to make someone have a particular feeling, thought etc again

trans.tran_cn: 重新点燃，再点火，<比喻>使再振作精神
trans.tran_en: If something rekindles an interest, feeling, or thought that you used to have, it makes you think about it or feel it again
